meanings.definition: A type of fastener used to secure two objects together.
meanings.sent1: I used swipples to hold the papers together.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter used swipples to connect the wooden planks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to steal the shiny swipples from the toolbox.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like swipples, connecting us all in joy.
meanings.sent5: The shiny swipples gleamed in the sunlight, holding the gate in place.

meanings.definition: To attach or fasten something using swipples.
meanings.sent1: She carefully swipples the fabric to the frame.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic swipples the parts together to fix the machine.
meanings.sent3: He swipples the keys to the keychain, making sure not to lose them.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship swipples them together through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The magician swipples the scarves, creating a colorful illusion.

meanings.definition: Describing something that is secured or fastened with swipples.
meanings.sent1: The swipples gate kept the garden safe from intruders.
meanings.sent2: The swipples rope held the swing securely in place.
meanings.sent3: The swipples curtain fluttered in the breeze, revealing a glimpse of the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like swipples, holding back the tears.
meanings.sent5: The swipples lock clicked shut, ensuring the door was locked tight.
